CSSTransform-functionRotateY.summary:
The rotateY() CSS function defines a transformation that rotates an element around the
y-axis (vertical) without deforming it. Its result is a {{cssxref("<transform-function>")}} data type.

remarks.para: The axis of rotation passes through an origin, defined by the transform-origin CSS property.

blockquote.para:
Note: rotateY(a) is equivalent to
rotate3d(0, 1, 0, a).

Note: Unlike rotations in the 2D plane, the composition of 3D rotations is usually
not commutative. In other words, the order in which the rotations are applied impacts the result.
